intro: Microcoelia konduensis, commonly known as the Kondu mountain orchid, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of India. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, sympodial growth habit. The plant produces small, colorful flowers that are typically white or pale pink, with intricate patterns on the petals. It thrives in cool, humid environments and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
